intro: Chamaesyce katrajensis, commonly known as the Katarajensis sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically yellow or greenish, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some traditional medicinal practices.
